---
title: "Job Trends in New Zealand"
author: "Kim Fitter"
date: 2026-02-13
tags: ["Python", "trends"]
description: "Analyzing job trends in New Zealand using pytrends"
format:
  html:
    code-fold: false
    toc: true
---

## Introduction

This post explores job trends in New Zealand using the **pytrends** library. 

[pytrends](https://pypi.org/project/pytrends/) is an unofficial API for Google Trends that allows you to programmatically access Google Trends data. It provides a simple interface to:

- Query search interest over time
- Compare multiple search terms
- Analyze regional interest
- Discover related queries and topics
- Track trending searches

This makes it an excellent tool for analyzing job market trends, as search volume for job-related terms can indicate hiring demand and career interest patterns.

## Setup

Let's start by importing the pytrends library and checking its version:

::: {#18c2de72 .cell execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code}
from pytrends.request import TrendReq
import importlib.metadata

# Get the version
version = importlib.metadata.version('pytrends')
print(f"pytrends version: {version}")
print("✅ pytrends library successfully imported!")
print(f"✅ TrendReq class available: {TrendReq}")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
pytrends version: 4.9.2
✅ pytrends library successfully imported!
✅ TrendReq class available: <class 'pytrends.request.TrendReq'>
```
:::
:::


## Next Steps

With pytrends set up, future analyses could include:

- Tracking search trends for specific job titles in New Zealand
- Comparing interest in different tech skills over time
- Analyzing regional variations in job search patterns
- Identifying seasonal hiring trends

Stay tuned for more detailed analysis!
